title: Update regarding Quantum
story_body:
Quantum Corporation (QNTM), a leading technology firm with a significant presence in the city of Austin, Texas, has announced a series of updates on its personnel, marketing initiatives, and environmental, social, and governance (ESG) efforts.

In personnel news, Quantum has appointed a new head of its Austin office, which is home to over 500 employees. The company has not disclosed the name of the new appointee, but sources indicate that the individual has extensive experience in the tech industry and a deep understanding of the local business community.

On the marketing front, Quantum has launched a new campaign targeting the city's thriving startup scene. The initiative, which includes partnerships with local incubators and accelerators, aims to raise awareness about Quantum's products and services among Austin's entrepreneurial community.

In ESG news, Quantum has announced plans to reduce its carbon footprint at its Austin facility by 10% over the next 12 months. The company has also partnered with the City of Austin's Office of Sustainability to promote environmental stewardship and community engagement. Quantum's Austin office has been recognized for its commitment to sustainability, having been named one of the city's "Greenest Employers" by the Austin Business Journal.

Locally, Quantum has been an active participant in discussions around the City of Austin's proposed tech industry development plan. The company has expressed support for initiatives aimed at promoting workforce development and improving the city's transportation infrastructure.

With over 1,500 employees in the state of Texas, Quantum remains a significant player in the local tech industry. The company's commitment to the community is evident in its ongoing efforts to promote sustainability, support local businesses, and contribute to the city's economic growth.
